result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin A Clark

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin A Clark not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Dustin A Clark.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-17-2022 and all responses to be filed by 12-15-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dustin A Clark not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Dustin A Clark.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dustin A Clark in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Dustin A Clark in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Michael Cerniglia
Court ordered an oral No Contact Order with LRM,;

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dustin A Clark in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Dustin A Clark in custody at Jackson.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dustin A Clark appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
